author: wsjcom
title: It’s a Mistake to Eulogize Brexit Before It Happens
text: Fraser Nelson notes that, despite the dire predictions of some prognosticators, the U.K. economy has performed well since the Brexit vote of June 2016 (“The U.K. Is Doing Just Fine, Thanks,” Review, March 24). This is true, but it would be foolish to draw firm conclusions about what will happen when Brexit actually occurs. Britain’s withdrawal from the European Union won’t begin until at least March 2019, will likely take years to unfold and longer for the political and economic consequences to become clear. Mr. Nelson is right when he says that the Brexit vote wasn’t in any case primarily about economics. This was true...
